com.comthings.gollum.api.gollumandroidlib.duktape

Class GollumJS

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.comthings.gollum.api.gollumandroidlib.duktape.GollumJS
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GollumJSInterface

    public class GollumJS
extends java.lang.Object
implements GollumJSInterface
    GollumJS is a class to bind GollumDongle Java methods to JS methods and execute a JS script.

      • rxSetup

        public int rxSetup(int freq,
                   int mod,
                   int drate,
                   int flen,
                   int chanbw,
                   int deviation)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Configure Dongle for RX
        Specified by:
        rxSetup in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        freq - The frequency to use, in Hz
        mod - The modulation value to use. Cf. Common.getModulationValue(String) for possible values
        drate - Sampling rate, in Hz
        flen - Size (in bytes) of the packet that the CC1111 transceiver needs to capture before sending it to Android
        chanbw - Receiver Channel Filter Bandwidth in Hz
        deviation - Channel deviation, in Hz. Only used for 2-FSK/GFSK/MSK
        Returns:
        0 if operation successfully completed, -1 in case of error

      • txSend

        public int txSend(java.lang.String buffer,
                  int rx_size,
                  boolean async,
                  int repeat)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Send data as a byte array in the form [0x41, 0x42, 0x30, 0x46, ...]
        Specified by:
        txSend in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        buffer - as a byte array in the form [0x41, 0x42, 0x30, 0x46, ...]. Data is not sent to PandwaRF in this form. Internally converted to hex byte array before sending.
        rx_size - Not used.
        async - true to send in async mode (doesn't wait for ack from PandwaRF), false to send in sync mode (wait for PandwaRF ack)
        repeat - number of SW or HW repeat times: 1 = single TX, 2 = 2 TX, etc. If data buffer fits into 1 frame, repeat is handled by FW. * If data buffer is longer than 1 frame, repeat is handled by SW
        Returns:
        0 if operation successfully completed, -1 in case of error

      • startDataRateMeas

        public int startDataRateMeas(int freq,
                             int mod,
                             int drate,
                             int chanbw,
                             int deviation,
                             int threshold_occ_winner)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Measure data rate
        Specified by:
        startDataRateMeas in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        freq - The frequency to use, in Hz
        mod - The modulation value to use. Cf. Common.getModulationValue(String) for possible values
        drate - Sampling rate, in Hz
        chanbw - Receiver Channel Filter Bandwidth, in Hz. If 0: calculates the optimal ChanBW setting for the current freq/baud
        deviation - Channel deviation, in Hz. Only used for 2-FSK/GFSK/MSK
        threshold_occ_winner - Number of occurence needed for a duration to be elected as the winner
        Returns:
        0 if operation successfully completed, -1 in case of error

      • startJamming

        public void startJamming(int startFrequency,
                         int stopFrequency,
                         int dataRate,
                         int modulation)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Start RF jamming

        Warning: calling this method causes the CC1111 to reset, in order to start Jamming with clean parameters. All RF parameters set prior to this method call will be lost.

        Specified by:
        startJamming in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        startFrequency - The start Frequency to use in Hz
        stopFrequency - The stop Frequency to use in Hz
        dataRate - Target data rate, in bits/s
        modulation - The modulation value to use. Cf. Common.getModulationValue(String) for possible values

        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface

        Specified by:

        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Configure the delay between 2 Spectrum Analyzer packets
        Specified by:
        setSpecanPktDelay in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        pkt_delay_ms - delay in ms between packets (max 255 ms)

      • startBruteForceAttack

        public void startBruteForceAttack(int frequency,
                                  int dataRate,
                                  int modulation,
                                  int deviation,
                                  int codeLength,
                                  int startValue,
                                  int stopValue,
                                  int repeat,
                                  boolean littleEndian,
                                  int delay_btw_attempts_ms,
                                  int encSymbolZero,
                                  int encSymbolOne,
                                  int encSymbolTwo,
                                  int encSymbolThree,
                                  int syncWordSize,
                                  java.lang.String syncWord)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        All in one message to start a Brute Force
        Specified by:
        startBruteForceAttack in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        frequency - The frequency to use in Hz
        dataRate - Target data rate, in bits/s
        modulation - The modulation value to use. Cf. com.comthings.gollum.api.gollumandroidlib.common.Common#getModulationValue(String) for possible values
        deviation - Channel deviation, in Hz. Only used for 2-FSK/GFSK/MSK
        codeLength - Number of Symbols in CodeWord
        startValue - The start value of Brute Force from where you want to begin
        stopValue - The stop value of Brute Force at which you want to stop
        repeat - Frame Repetition. Number of Frames to send for each BruteForce attempt. Reduce this parameter to go faster
        littleEndian - Endianess. The byte-order to use, generally Big-Endian. True for Little-Endian, false for Big-Endian
        delay_btw_attempts_ms - Delay between each frame to send. Minimum value is 100ms for a regular PandwaRF, 0ms for a PandwaRF Rogue
        encSymbolZero - How to encode symbol '0'
        encSymbolOne - How to encode symbol '1'
        encSymbolTwo - How to encode symbol '2'
        encSymbolThree - How to encode symbol '3'
        syncWordSize - Synchronisation word size, in bytes.
        syncWord - Synchronisation word, in hexadecimal. Synchronisation is pre-pended before the CodeWord.

      • stopBruteForceAttack

        public void stopBruteForceAttack()
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Stop the Brute Force attack
        Specified by:
        stopBruteForceAttack in interface GollumJSInterface

      • setupBruteForceAttack

        public void setupBruteForceAttack(int frequency,
                                  int dataRate,
                                  int modulation,
                                  int deviation,
                                  int codeLength,
                                  int startValue,
                                  int stopValue,
                                  int repeat,
                                  boolean littleEndian,
                                  int delay_btw_attempts_ms,
                                  int encSymbolZero,
                                  int encSymbolOne,
                                  int encSymbolTwo,
                                  int encSymbolThree,
                                  int syncWordSize,
                                  java.lang.String syncWord)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Setup the Brute Force. Requires a Brute Force Start SyncCodeTail to start the BF.

        Warning: calling this method causes the CC1111 to reset, in order to start BF with clean parameters. All RF parameters set prior to this method call will be lost.

        Specified by:
        setupBruteForceAttack in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        frequency - The frequency to use in Hz
        dataRate - Target data rate, in bits/s
        modulation - The modulation value to use. Cf. com.comthings.gollum.api.gollumandroidlib.common.Common#getModulationValue(String) for possible values
        deviation - Channel deviation, in Hz. Only used for 2-FSK/GFSK/MSK
        codeLength - Number of Symbols in CodeWord
        startValue - The start value of Brute Force from where you want to begin
        stopValue - The stop value of Brute Force at which you want to stop
        repeat - Frame Repetition. Number of Frames to send for each BruteForce attempt. Reduce this parameter to go faster
        littleEndian - Endianess. The byte-order to use, generally Big-Endian. True for Little-Endian, false for Big-Endian
        delay_btw_attempts_ms - Delay between each frame to send. Minimum value is 100ms for a regular PandwaRF, 0ms for a PandwaRF Rogue
        encSymbolZero - How to encode symbol '0'
        encSymbolOne - How to encode symbol '1'
        encSymbolTwo - How to encode symbol '2'
        encSymbolThree - How to encode symbol '3'
        syncWordSize - Synchronisation word size, in bytes.
        syncWord - Synchronisation word, in hexadecimal. Synchronisation is pre-pended before the CodeWord.

      • setupLongSymbolBruteForceAttack

        public void setupLongSymbolBruteForceAttack(int frequency,
                                            int dataRate,
                                            int modulation,
                                            int deviation,
                                            int delayBtwAttemptsMs,
                                            int symbolLength,
                                            java.lang.String encSymbolZero,
                                            java.lang.String encSymbolOne,
                                            java.lang.String encSymbolTwo,
                                            java.lang.String encSymbolThree)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Setup the Brute Force with long symbols Requires a Brute Force Start SyncCodeTail to start the BF

        Warning: calling this method causes the CC1111 to reset, in order to start BF with clean parameters. All RF parameters set prior to this method call will be lost.

        Specified by:
        setupLongSymbolBruteForceAttack in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        frequency - The frequency to use in Hz
        dataRate - Target data rate, in bits/s
        modulation - The modulation value to use. Cf. com.comthings.gollum.api.gollumandroidlib.common.Common#getModulationValue(String) for possible values
        deviation - Channel deviation, in Hz. Only used for 2-FSK/GFSK/MSK
        delayBtwAttemptsMs - Delay between each frame to send. Minimum value is 100ms for a regular PandwaRF, 0ms for a PandwaRF Rogue
        symbolLength - Length of a symbol. Min: 1, max: 3
        encSymbolZero - How to encode symbol '0'
        encSymbolOne - How to encode symbol '1'
        encSymbolTwo - How to encode symbol '2'
        encSymbolThree - How to encode symbol '3'

      • setupBruteForceAttackFunction

        public void setupBruteForceAttackFunction(java.lang.String functionMask,
                                          java.lang.String functionValue)
        Description copied from interface: GollumJSInterface
        Brute Force setup of the Function Mask and Value. Optional after a Brute Force Setup and before Brute Force Start SyncCodeTail to start the BF
        Specified by:
        setupBruteForceAttackFunction in interface GollumJSInterface
        Parameters:
        functionMask - This is like a Mask IP Address. Every symbol noted FF is brute-forced, and every symbol noted 00 is fixed.
        functionValue - This is the "contrary" of functionMask. Every symbol noted 00 is not fixed, and every symbol that you want to be fixed needs to be set here.
